post.summary: List Payroll Data and Attendance Calendar Entries
post.description:
This endpoint returns a list of payroll data and attendance calendar time entries with a date range with the earning code selected. Additionally, you can restrict the entries returned by employee number, attendance codes and employee number.

The API User must have role permissions to the employee and have access to the employee's pay group. Go to [Allow Employee Access](/docs/auth-users.md) for more information on setting up the user with the correct employee access.

get.description:
Returns a list of the Employment Default Groups. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.DefaultGroups.

In Avanti, these Default Groups can help quickly setup new employees based on common setup requirements. Default Groups can be set up to add earning and deduction/benefit codes, position, employee values, vacation groups, unions, and more. If a setup change is required, Default Groups can quickly update all employees within a group.

get.description:
Returns all the most important details of your employee's benefits. 

Name Format   

The employees, dependents and beneficiaries' names are all formatted based on the user's name format. These formats are returned as: 

  0 is the last name, then the first name

  1 is the first name, then the last name

  2 is the last name, then the preferred name

  3 is the preferred name, then the last name

  4 is the last name, then the first name's initial

  5 is the first name's initial, then the last name

  6 is the last name, then the preferred name's initial 
  
  7 is the preferred name's initial, then the last name

  8 is the preferred name, then the last name's initial

  9 is the first name, and then the last name's initial

parameters.description: The IDs of the notification types you would like to get the data for. If blank, notifications for all types are returned.

If blank, the most recent notifications are returned.

parameters.description:
Used with the notificationId parameter to determine which notifications to return. 
If True or blank, notifications more recent than the notificationId are returned. 
If false, notifications older than the notificationId are returned.

parameters.description: If true, only unread notifications are returned. If false, all notifications are returned. Default is false.

parameters.description: Only notifications that contain this text in the subject or content are returned.

parameters.name: lastLoaded
parameters.description:
Returns a list of notifications with a changed read status after this date. The date in ISO 8601 format.
These notifications are returned in read and unread. This can be used address caching when users access notifications across different devices.

post.description:
Create payroll time for your employees. This incorporates payroll data prepared by other systems into your Avanti pay.

Every time this endpoint is used, a new payroll batch is created unless you import it into a staging table. If you import to a staging table, all entries will get created into a batch when import from a table is selected in Payroll Data Entry.

The API User must have user group access to the employee's pay group to import entries for an employee.

put.description:
Update the employee's personal information in Avanti.

The best practice is to do a Get Personal Info, update the required values, then do a Put Personal Info. You can adjust the following information for the employee. 

- Given Name, Surname, Initial, Preferred Name, Previous Surname
- Address Line 1, Address Line 2, City, Prov, Country, Postal Code
- Birth Date, First Language, Gender, Email
- Phone Type 1, Phone Number 1, Phone Type 2, Phone Number 2, Phone Type 3, Phone Number 3, Phone Type 4, Phone Number 4
- Modified Date, Modified Time

All updates will log in the employee change log.

post.description:
This will return the contents of the specified report based on the options selected. Using this endpoint, additional report options can be included in the request body to ensure only the information you require is included in the results. If you are only filtering the report result by a date range and employee range, please use the Get Report Data endpoint. You can try the Reporter endpoint by using the ID WageSample in 'Send a Test Request'. >##### Additional Information >The report must be web-enabled, and the API User must have Print access to the report.

Want additional information on setting up a report? Go to [Custom Endpoints.](https://avanti.stoplight.io/docs/avanti-api/ZG9jOjgxNDM2NzE-custom-endpoints) to learn more. Employee Access
The API User must have pay group and Time Entry role permissions to return an employee's information. Role permissions aren't restricted based on inactive positions; if the user has access to an employee's inactive position, the employee's information is returned.

200.description: Ok. (Returns a dynamic object created from the report. For more informmation, go to https://avanti.stoplight.io/docs/avanti-api/ZG9jOjgxNDM2NzE-custom-endpoints)

get.description:
This will return the contents of the specified report based. Using this endpoint, the information returned can be filtered based on date range and employee range. If you need the report to filtered by additional options, please use the Get Report Data With Options endpoint. You can try the Reporter endpoint by using the ID WageSample in 'Send a Test Request'. >##### Additional Information >The report must be web-enabled, and the API User must have Print access to the report.

Want additional information on setting up a report? Go to [Custom Endpoints.](https://avanti.stoplight.io/docs/avanti-api/ZG9jOjgxNDM2NzE-custom-endpoints) to learn more. Employee Access
The API User must have pay group and Time Entry role permissions to return an employee's information. Role permissions aren't restricted based on inactive positions; if the user has access to an employee's inactive position, the employee's information is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the notification you would like to get the data for.

parameters.name: fromEmpNo
parameters.description: The first employee number in the range of employees employees used to filter the data.This is required if toEmpNo is defined. If blank, returns data for all employees.

parameters.name: toEmpNo
parameters.description: The last employee in the range of employees used to filter the data. This is required if fromEmpNo is defined. If blank, returns data for all employees.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The first date in the range of dates used to filter the data.This is required if toDate is defined. If blank, returns data for all dates.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The last date in the range of dates used to filter the data. This is required if fromDate is defined. If blank, returns data for all dates.

parameters.name: merge
parameters.description: If true, the options set on the report definition will be used. If false, the options on the report definition will be ignored.

200.description: Ok. (Returns a dynamic object created from the report. For more informmation, go to https://avanti.stoplight.io/docs/avanti-api/ZG9jOjgxNDM2NzE-custom-endpoints)

post.description:
Incorporate schedules prepared by other systems into your Avanti time with the Add Schedules endpoint. 

The API User must have user group access to the pay group and time entry role permission for the employee to add schedules. 

If there are any errors, no schedule entries are added.

parameters.name: replaceExisting
parameters.description: If true, schedules with a duplicate reference number replaces the original schedules. Otherwise, entries with duplicates won't be added. If left blank, this is false.

get.description:
Returns a list of the schedule templates. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.ScheduleTemplates. 

In Avanti, Schedule templates define the commonly used schedule rotations. These rotations can be used to create employee schedules automatically by rolling schedules forward or on demand by adding the schedule template for a specific day.

This returns a list of the menus that contain the text from the request in the:
- Menu Description
-  Menu URL
- Program name

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Only menu that contain this text in the description, URL or program name are returned.

get.description:
Returns a list of the shift codes. 

In Avanti, shift codes are used in Schedules and Time Cards to apply default from/to times, break rules and premium rules.

Returns a list of the defined tasks.

In Avanti, Task Ids are used throughout time entry. These are for tracking purposes and are defined to suit your organizations needs.

post.description:
Create time data entries for your employees. 

This can be used when you have time data information prepared by other systems that you wish to incorporate into Time and Attendance module in Avanti.

If some time data entries don't pass validation, a message is returned and the entries won't be imported. All valid entries are created.

Important Information - Break rules dont apply to added time data entries.

get.description:
Returns a list of the Union Codes defined. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.Unions. 

In Avanti, Union Codes identify the union affiliations and are used to determine union dues.

Returns a list of the earning codes setup for paying vacation each period or to pay out accrued. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.VacationEarningCodes. 

In Avanti, vacation earning codes must have either Vacation or Other Vacation selected for the Earning Type.

Returns a list of the defined vacation group. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.VacationGroups. 

In Avanti, vacation groups determine the vacation entitlement calculation for each employee assigned to the group.

Returns a list of the vacation options. The Text will always be the description of the option.

In Avanti, the Vacation Option indicates what will happen with the calculated vacation for an employee.

Returns a list of the Workers Compensation Groups. 

In Avanti, these maintain all WCB rates and maximums for payroll processing.

Returns the most recent punch of the employee attached to the user unless the last punch was for a break. If the previous punch was a break, it returns all punches for the shift, including the last check-in.

post.description:
Creates a punch for the employee. 

The time of the punch is the current time on the SQL Server, adjusted by the time zone specified on Web Punch Employee Setup on the Desktop Application. If there is no setup for the employee, the time will be adjusted by the Province of Employment on the Tax Factors tab of the Employee Profile.

Employees cannot punch if Allow Web Punch is not selected on Time Clock >> Installation & Maintenance >> Employee Web & PC Punch Setup. 

If company web setting MobileSettings.WebPunchSettings.RequireLocationServices is true, longitude and latitude must be included.

200.description: Returns a confirmation with information added in Avanti.

get.description:
Returns true if the employee can punch and false if the employee cannot. 

Employees cannot punch if Allow Web Punch is not selected on Time Clock >> Installation & Maintenance >> Employee Web & PC Punch Setup.

Returns a list of the defined employee work groups. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.WorkGroups.

In Avanti, Work Groups are used to determine which employees enter time using Time and Attendance. These group employees based on common rules and shift(s). Each Work Group has a Holiday Rule, Punch Rule and Overtime Rule and one or more Shifts.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

earningCode.description: The three-digit earning code for the entry. Earning Codes are from 001 to 499.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked. 

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

empNo.description: The employee number assigned to the employee.

earningDate.description: The date the employee worked in ISO 8601 format.

earningCode.description: The three-digit earning code for the entry. Earning Codes are from 001 to 499.

positionCode.description:
The ID of the position worked. If the position is left blank, the employees primary position will be used if required for rates. 

If Only allow defined Employee Positions in time data entry is selected on the Time Data Entry tab of Payroll Parameters, the position must be on the employees profile.

attendanceCode.description:
The attendance code for the worked time. 

Must be a valid attendance code. 'Get Attendance Codes' will return the valid codes.

shiftIdCode.description:
The ID of the shift worked. If left blank, premium rules will not apply to the time worked.

Must be a valid shift ID. 'Get Shift Codes' will return a list of all the valid shifts.

wcbOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the WCB Group. If left blank, the time will apply to the WCB group selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid WCB group. 'List WCB Groups' will return a list of all the valid groups.

vacationOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the vacation group. If left blank, the time will apply to the vacation group selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid vacation group. 'List Vacation Groups' will return a list of all the valid groups.

unionOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the union code. If left blank, the time will apply to the union selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid union code. 'List Union Codes' will return a list of all the valid codes.

units.description:
The time the employee worked.
This is required if you aren't including a clockIn/clockOut. 
If blank, this is calculated based on the clockIn/clockOut.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked. 

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

recordSourceId.description:
A unique identifier for the time which prevents duplicate time from being accidently created in Avanti. If a duplicate recordSourceID is found within Avanti or in API body, the time will not import. 

For example, this could be the identifier from the time capturing system.

glAccount.description:
The GL account for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'a'.

Must be a valid account. 'List GL Accounts' will return the valid accounts for each segment. A combination of segments can be used to create the valid account.

glGroup.description:
The GL group for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'g'.

Must be a valid GL group. 'List GL Groups' will return the valid GL Groups.

glBenefitGroup.description:
A valid GL Benefit Group. This is required when parameter glType is 'a'.

Must be a valid GL Benefit Group. 'List GL Benefit Groups' will return the valid all the groups.

comments.description: Enter comments for the worked time. Comments can be up to 1024 characters.

clockIn.description:
This is required if you aren't including Units and unitOfMeasure. 
The time the employee started work. If left blank, Clock In defaults to midnight.

clockOut.description:
The time the employee finishes work.
This is required if you aren't including Units and unitOfMeasure. 
If you are including the units and unitOfMeasure, this defaults based on those.

text.description: The number of the Figures Field, from 1 to 15, in the order they appear on the Employee Profile. For example, M34 is 14.

value.description: A number between -999,999,999.99 and 999,999,999.99. Can be up to two decimal places.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee for this dependent.

code.description: The Deduction/Benefit codes which cover this dependent. This parameter cannot be used in an post or put at this time.

dependentNo.description: The number for the dependent. Each dependent for an employee will have a unique dependent number.

givenName.description: The first name of the employee's dependent.

surname.description: The last name of the employee's dependent.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's dependent.

relationship.description:
Indicates whether the dependent's relationship to the employee. 
   1 = Spouse
   2 = Child 
   3 = Common Law Spouse
   4 = Beneficiary
   5 = Other

birthDate.description: The date of the dependent's birth in ISO 8601 format.

gender.description:
Indicates whether the dependent's gender is female, male, or undefined. 
F is female.
M is male.
X is undefined.

useEmployeeAddress.description: Indicates whether the dependent lives with the employee. If true, the dependent's home address and phone number will default to the employee's address and phone number. Default is false.

address1.description: The first line of the dependent's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

address2.description: The second line of the dependent's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

city.description: The city for the dependent's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

province.description:
The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the dependent's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.
This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

country.description:
The three-character abbreviation of the country where the dependent resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.
This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

postal.description: The postal code of the employee's home address.

homePhone.description: The phone number for the dependent's home. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

smoker.description:
Whether the dependent is a smoker. Default is False. This may be used for benefit calculations.
    True for smoker
    False for nonsmoker

overage.description:
Indicates whether the dependent is over the age of majority. Default is 0. 
   0 = NA/under the age of majority
   1 = Student
   2 = Disabled
   3 = Disabled Student

cohabitationDate.description: The initial date that the dependent started living with the employee in ISO 8601 format.

trusteeRequired.description:
Whether the dependent requires a trustee. Defaults to false. 

If true, a trustee must be entered on the beneficiaries tab of Employee Benefits in the Avanti desktop application.

isEmployee.description: Whether the dependent is also an employee. Default is False. If True, dependentEmpNo must be specified.

dependentEmpNo.description: The dependents employee number, if the dependent is also an employee. This will only be used if the parameter isEmployee is true.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee that this emergency contact belongs to.

givenName.description: The first name of the employee's emergency contact.

surname.description: The last name of the employee's emergency contact.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's emergency contact.

useEmployeeAddress.description: Indicates whether the emergency contact lives with the employee. If true, the emergency contact's home address and phone number will default to the employee's address and phone number. Default is false.

address1.description: The first line of the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

address2.description: The second line of the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

city.description: The city for the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

province.description:
The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the emergency contact's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.
This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

country.description: The three-character abbreviation of the country where the employee resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.

postal.description: The postal code of the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

homePhone.description: The phone number for the emergency contact's home. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

workPhone.description: The phone number for the emergency contact's work.

comments.description: Additional information about the emergency contact. Can be up to 1024 characters.

relationship.description: The employee's relationship to the emergency contact. Must be a valid relationship code. 'Get Emergency Setup' will return the valid relationship codes.

photoRevision.description: Used to prevent photo caching. When the photo is updated or the existing photo is deleted, enter a unique value here to ensure that the changes are applied immediately.

userName.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

preferredName.description: The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.

address2.description: The second line of the employee's home address.

sin.description: The employee's Social Insurance Number. If this is not available, nine zeros will be accepted. If the SIN starts with a 9, a sinExpiryDate should be specified.

sinExpiryDate.description: The date the employee's temporary Social Insurance Number (SIN) will expire. If the employee's SIN begins with a 9, this should be specified. The SIN expiry is in ISO 8601 format.

email.description:

For example, if the employee does not have a Pay Statement email address defined, the pay statement will be emailed to the primary email.

table.description: The SQL table that contains the data that the report is being filtered on.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for each filter. Must be set.

description.description: This is for internal use, and cannot be set.

letter.description: Determines the order of the filters, A is first and Z is last.

fieldName.description: The field that the filter is being set on.

condition.description:
How the value must relate to the field name. Enter the number for the condition. 
  Enter 0 for < 
  Enter 1 for =
  Enter 2 for >
  Enter 3 for <=
  Enter 4 for <>
  Enter 5 for  >=
  Enter 6 for 'Like'
  Enter 7 for 'Not Like'
  Enter 8 for 'In'
  Enter 9 for 'Not In'

value.description: The value that the data will be compared to in the filter. If valueType is 3, this should be a SQL expression.

valueType.description:
Enter number of the type of value being used in the filter. 
   0 = Field Value
   1 = Field Name
   2 = SQL Expression

conjunction.description:
Determines how this filter relates to the next filter in the same filter table. The order of the filters depends on the filter letter.  
   0 = And
   1 = Or

If you are filtering the results by multiple tables, the data must meet the filters for both tables to be included.

openingBrackets.description:
The number of brackets before this filter that define the relationship between multiple filters. 
For example: If you want the filter relationship (A or B) and (C or D), enter 1 for openingBrackets on filter A and C.

closingBrackets.description:
The number of brackets after this filter that define the relationship between multiple filters. 
For example: If you want the filter relationship (A or B) and (C or D), enter 1 for closingBrackets on filter B and D.

field.description:
Filter the codes returned by ID or description. This is required if you're filtering the returned codes. 

Code will filter by the ID. Description will filter by the code's description.

operator.description:
Will return codes that contain the value or does not contain the value. This is required if you're filtering the returned codes. 

Contains will return codes that have the value. Doesnotcontain will return codes that do not have the value.

value.description:
The value that the returned code must contain or not contain. 

This is required if you're filtering the returned codes.

skip.description: The number of entries to skip.
The number of entries to skip.

take.description: The number of entries to take.

read.description: Returns all the notifications read since the lastLoaded date. This is only returned if lastLoaded is included in the request parameters.

unread.description: Returns all the notifications marked as unread since the lastLoaded date. This is only returned if lastLoaded is included in the request parameters.

typeId.description: The identifier for the notification type.

parentId.description:
Will display the notification type id, if this notification type is a subcategory. 
If -1 is returned, this notification type is not a subcategory.

required.description:
If True, employees will be unable to change whether they will receive these notifications. If False, employees can choose whether they will receive these notifications. 
Whether employees can receive this notification type will be determined based on the selection for Enabled.

sin.description: The employee's Social Insurance Number. If this is not available, nine zeros will be accepted. If the SIN starts with a 9, a sinExpiryDate should be specified.

allEmployees.description:
True will include all employees in the report. False will only include the employee range. If false, the employee range must be specified in fromEmpNo toEmpNo. 

Reports only include employees based on the active parameter, role permissions, and pay group access.

fromEmpNo.description: The first employee number in the range of employees employees used to filter the data. This is only used if allEmployees is false. This is required if toEmpNo is defined.

toEmpNo.description: The last employee in the range of employees used to filter the data. This is only used if allEmployees is false. This is required if fromEmpNo is defined.

active.description: True will include active employees in the results. False prevents active employees from being included in the results.

inactive.description: True will include inactive employees in the results. False prevents inactive employees from being included in the results.

allDates.description: True to include all dates in the report. False to include a date range. If false, the date range must be specified in fromDate toDate.

fromDate.description: The first date in the range of dates used to filter the data. This is only used if allDates is false. This is required if toDate is defined.

toDate.description: The last date in the range of dates used to filter the data. This is only used if allDates is false. This is required if fromDate is defined.

Ex: selectedPayGroups: ["001", "002"] will only include employees in group 001 or 002 in the report.

allLocations.description: True will include all employees in the report regardless of their location. False will only include the employees in the locations indicated in the selectedLocations parameter.

selectedLocations.description:
The location codes of employees that will be included in the report. This will only be used if parameter allLocations is false.
Ex: selectedLocations: ["001", "002"] will only include employees in location 001 or 002 in the report.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

isInPunch.description: Indicates whether the punch is a punch in or punch out. If true, it is an in punch. If false, it is an out punch. Default is false.

isBreak.description: Indicates whether the punch is for a break. If true, it is for a break. If false, it is not for a break. Default is false.

punchDateTime.description:
The time of the punch is the current time on the SQL Server, adjusted by the time zone specified on Web Punch Employee Setup on the Desktop Application. If there is no setup for the employee, the time will be adjusted by the Province of Employment on the Tax Factors tab of the Employee Profile.

This will be generated on a Post and should not be included in the body.

latitude.description:
Indicates the latitude of the employees location when they punched. This is required if company web setting MobileSettings.WebPunchSettings.RequireLocationServices is true. 

This will not be returned when doing a get.

longitude.description:
Indicates the longitude of the employee's location when they punched. This is required if company web setting MobileSettings.WebPunchSettings.RequireLocationServices is true. 

This will not be returned when doing a get.

title.description: This property is not used at this time.

fromTime.description: The From Date and Time in iSO 8601 format. Only entries after this are returned.

toTime.description: The To Date and Time in iSO 8601 format. Only entries before this date are returned.

earnDeductCode.description: The three-digit earning, deduction or benefit code. Only entries with code are returned.

employeeNumbers.description: Entries are only returned for the employees listed. If blank, entries are returned for all employees.

payGroups.description: The three digit ID of the pay groups. Entries are only returned for employees in the pay groups.

attendanceCodes.description: The ID of the attendance codes. Only entries with these attendance codes are returned.

active.description: Enter true to return entries for active employees. If blank or false, entries are only returned for inactive employees.
If left blank, defaut is True. The project account must be active to use the GL account. Inactive accounts cannot be used for new account validation, and are used for reporting.

effectiveDate.description: If specified, the entry date must be on or after the effective date for the account to be used. The effective date is in ISO 8601 format.

expiryDate.description: If specified, the entry date must be before or on the expiry date for the account to be used. The effective expiry is in ISO 8601 format.

type.description: The ID of the project's type.

validationMask.description: Enter the GL account format, with the account in the correct segment. For additional GL validation, replace other aspects of the account. Accounts must match the replaced aspect to pass validation.

description.description: A longer description of the project.

account.description: The project account. This must match the format of the project segment.

name.description: The description of project account, which can be up to 50 characters.

abbreviation.description: A short name for the project, which can be up to 10 characters.

segmentNo.description: The GL segment number for the phase.

PhaseIdentifier.description: Sets which phases can be used with the Project.

useAttendReason.description:
Returns Y if the pay code uses attendance codes. Returns N if the pay code doesn't. 
Only applicable if the pay code has an earning code.

useShifts.description:
Returns whether shifts are used, optional or required for the pay code. 
Returns 0 if a shifts code isn't allowed. 
Returns 1 if a shifts code is  optional.
Returns 2 if a shift code is required.

earnCode.description: The three-digit earning or deduction code for the entry. Earning Codes are from 001 to 499.

useUnits.description: Returns True if the pay code uses units and units of measure. Returns False if the pay code uses from/to times.

defaultUnits.description:
The default number of units if the pay code is selected when inserting an entry. 
Only applicable if useUnits is True.

defaultUnitCode.description:
The default unit of measure if the pay code is selected when inserting an entry. Only applicable if useUnits is True. 
H is hours.
D is days. 
U is units.

useOnlyInSchedules.description: Returns True if the pay code is only used in Schedules, false if it's used elsewhere in Time & Attendance.

excludeFromTotals.description: Returns True if entries are excluded from schedule totals. Returns False if entries are included in schedule totals.

r.description: Returns the r value used to create the rgb color. Only used if useColor is true.

g.description: Returns the g value used to create the rgb color. Only used if useColor is true.

b.description: Returns the B value used to create the rgb color. Only used if useColor is true.

useColor.description: Returns True if a color displays on cells with an entry with the pay code. Uses the rgb color.

active.description: Returns True if the pay code is active, false if it's inactive.

allowOverlappingTimes.description: Returns True if entries can overlap with other schedules entries. Returns Fase if schedule entries cannot overlap.

overlappingFromTime.description:
Sets the overlapping from time.
Only used if useUnits is True and allowOverlappingTimes is false.

overlappingToTime.description:
Returns the overlapping to time.
Only used if useUnits is True and allowOverlappingTimes is false.

code.description: The Deduction/Benefit codes for the beneficiary.

givenName.description: The first name of the employee's beneficiary.

surname.description: The last name of the employee's beneficiary.

initial.description: The middle name initial of the employee's beneficiary.

percentage.description: The percentage amount that the beneficiary is entitled to.

revocable.description: Returns Y if the beneficiary is revocable. Returns N if the beneficiary is irrevocable.

code.description: Returns the three-digit code for the benefit code.

expiryDate.description: The date the benefit ends in ISO 8601 format.

expiryDateString.description: This property is not used at this time.

coverageOverride.description: Returns Y if the coverage amount is different for the employee than the benefit code.

waived.description: Returns Y if the employee declined the benefit, N if the benefit if they opted in for the benefit.

certificate.description: The certificate number that is assigned to the employee by the benefit provider.

coverageEffectiveDate.description: The date the benefit begins in ISO 8601 format.

coverageEffectiveDateString.description: This property is not used at this time.

dependentsFormatted.description: The format of the dependant's name. The options are in the description above.

beneficiariesFormatted.description: The format of the beneficiaries' name. The options are in the description above.

nameFormat.description: The format of the employees's name. The options are in the description above.

displayPercentages.description:
Returns true/false based on company web setting BenefitsSettings.DisplayPercentages. 

This setting determines whether administrators want to display the beneficiaries' percentage in the Avanti Self-Service Portal.

daysBeforeEffective.description:
Returns a number based on company web setting BenefitsSettings.BenefitsSettings.DisplayDaysBeforeEffective. 

This setting determines when the benefit starts displaying on the Avanti Self-Service Portal, based on the days before the benefit's effective date. 

For example, if this is seven, the benefit displays on the Avanti Self-Service Portal a week before the effective date.

daysAfterExpiry.description:
Returns a number based on company web setting BenefitsSettings.BenefitsSettings.DisplayDaysAfterExpiry. 

This setting determines when the benefit stops displaying on the Avanti Self-Service Portal, based on the number of days after the benefits' expiry date. 

For example, if this is 14, the benefit displays on the Avanti Self-Service Portal for two weeks after the expiry date.

id.description:
This gets included in the response. You can use this to map error messages to invalid entries. 

When making a post request, leave this blank.

empNo.description: The employee number assigned to the employee.

entryDate.description: The date of the payroll data entry in ISO 8601 format.

earnDeductCode.description: The three-digit earning or deduction code for the entry. Earning Codes are from 001 to 499. Deduction Codes are from 500 to 999.

positionCode.description:
The ID of the position worked. If the position is left blank, the employee's primary position will be used if required for rates.

If Only allow defined Employee Positions in time data entry is selected on the Time Data Entry tab in Payroll Parameters, the position must be on the employees profile.

units.description: The units for the payroll data entry.

dollarRate.description:
The dollar rate of pay. This will only be used for earnings if earnDeductCode is 001 to 499.

If left blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

earningAmount.description:
Enter the earning amount for the entry. If you're using dollarRate, this must match the total for the units by dollarRate.

This is only used if the earnDeductCode is between 001-499.

benefitAmount.description: The total benefit amount for the entry. This is only used if the earnDeductCode is between 500-999.

deductionAmount.description: The total deduction amount for the entry. This is only used if the earnDeductCode is between 500-999.

glGroup.description:
The GL group for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'g'.

Must be a valid GL group. 'List GL Groups' will return the valid GL Groups.

glAccount.description:
"The GL account for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'a'.

Must be a valid account. 'List GL Accounts' will return the valid accounts for each segment. A combination of segments can be used to create the valid account.

glBenefitGroup.description:
The GL group for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'g'.

Must be a valid GL group. 'List GL Groups' will return the valid GL Groups.

wcbOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the WCB Group. If left blank, the time will apply to the WCB group selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid WCB group. 'List WCB Groups' will return a list of all the valid groups.

attendanceCode.description:
The attendance code for the worked time.

Must be a valid attendance code. 'Get Attendance Codes' will return the valid codes.

attendanceReason.description: Up to 1024 alphanumeric characters that will populate the comments on the payroll data entry.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked.

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

locationCode.description:
The location code for the worked time.

Must be a valid location code. 'List Locations' will return the valid codes.

batchDescription.description:
An alphanumeric description for the payroll batch, which can be up to 1024 characters. This is required when importToStagingTable is False.

This isn't used if importToStagingTable is True.

batchCompleted.description: Enter True if the batch is complete. Default is False. This isn't used when importToStagingTable is True.

stopImportOnAnyError.description: If True, no entries will import if one of the entries is invalid. Default is False.

importToStagingTable.description: If True, payroll data will import into a staging table. If False, a new batch is created each time the endpoint is used. Default is False.

empNo.description: The employee number assigned to the employee.

dedFig.description: The text portion corresponds to the figureFieldLabels and the value is the employees information for the figure field.

otherDate.description: The text portion corresponds to the dateFieldLabels and the value is the employees information for the date field.

otherText.description: The text portion corresponds to the textFieldLabels and the value is the employees information for the text field.

textFieldLabels.description:
Returns the display label with the associated value.

The value only returns the numeric portion, so the if the text field is T19, this returns 19.

dateFieldLabels.description: Returns the date label with the value of the the date field. The value only returns the numeric portion, so the if the date is M15, this returns 15.

figureFieldLabels.description: Returns the figure label with the value of the the figure field. The value only returns the numeric portion, so the if the figure ID is M30, 30 returns.

disabledDedFiguresForEmployees.description:
Returns the figures that employees can't update. 

This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the figure is M30, this returns 30.

disabledOtherTextsForEmployees.description:
Returns the other text information that employees can't update. 

This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the text field is T19, this returns 19.

disabledOtherDatesForEmployees.description:
Returns the dates that employees can't update. 

This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the date is M15, this returns 15.

disabledDedFiguresForManagers.description:
Returns the figures that managers can't update for other employees. 
This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the figure ID is M30, 30 returns.

disabledOtherTextsForManagers.description:
Returns the other text information that managers can't update for other employees.

This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the text field is T19, this returns 19.

disabledOtherDatesForManagers.description:
Returns the dates that managers can't update for other employees. 
This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the date is M15, this returns 15.

disabledDedFiguresForManagerSelf.description:
Returns the figures that managers can't update for their employee. 
This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the figure ID is M30, 30 returns.

disabledOtherTextsForManagerSelf.description:
Returns the other text information that managers can't update for their employee.

This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the text field is T19, this returns 19.

disabledOtherDatesForManagerSelf.description:
Returns the dates that managers can't update for their employee. 

This only returns the numeric portion, so the if the date is M15, this returns 15.

textFieldData.description: The key indicates is the text field ID. The text returns the description that appears in the dropdown, the value is the the ID.

textFieldLabels.description:
Returns the display label with the associated value. 

The value only returns the numeric portion, so the if the text field is T19, this returns 19.

dateFieldLabels.description:
Returns the date label with the value of the the date field. 
The value only returns the numeric portion, so the if the date is M15, this returns 15.

figureFieldLabels.description:
Returns the figure label with the value of the the figure field. 
The value only returns the numeric portion, so the if the figure ID is M30, 30 returns.

employeeNumber.description: The employee number assigned to the employee.

scheduleDate.description: The date the employee is scheduled worked in ISO 8601 format.

payCode.description:
The pay code for the scheduled time.
It must be a valid pay code. 'List Pay Codes' will return the valid codes.

fromTime.description:
The time the employee is scheduled to start work, in minutes since midnight. 
If the pay code's entry type is From To Times, this is required.

toTime.description:
The time the employee is scheduled to end work, in minutes since midnight. 
If you don't including amount and unitOfMeasure, this is required.

amount.description:
The amount of time the employee is scheduled to work. This corresponds to the unitOfMeasure. 
This is required if the pay code's entry type is Units and Unit Code.

unitOfMeasure.description:
The unit of measure for the units indicated. D is in Days. H is in Hours. U is in Units. 
This is required if the pay code's entry type is Units and Unit Code.

shiftId.description:
The ID of the scheduled shift. If left blank, premium rules and break rules will not apply to the time worked.

Must be a valid shift ID. 'Get Shift Codes' will return a list of all the valid shifts.

locationCode.description:
The location code for the scheduled time.

It must be a valid location code. 'List Locations' will return the valid codes.

positionCode.description:
The ID of the position the employee is scheduled to work. If left blank, the employee's primary position is used for rates, if required.

If Only allow defined Employee Positions in time data entry is selected on the Payroll Parameter's Time Data Entry tab, the position must be on the employees profile.

payPrimaryPosition.description:
If true, the employee is paid their primary position rate, regardless of the position on the schedule. 
If left blank, this is false.

attendanceCode.description:
The attendance code for the scheduled time.

Must be a valid attendance code. 'Get Attendance Codes' will return the valid codes.

comment.description: Up to 1024 alphanumeric characters populates the schedule entry comments.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the schedule.

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get Task Ids' endpoint.

referenceNumber.description:
This ensures the same schedule is not accidentally added twice.
If replaceExisting is True, added schedules with a duplicate reference number won't be added. 
If replaceExisting is False, added schedules with a duplicate reference number replace the existing schedule.

empNo.description: The employee number for the employee document was added to.

description.description: The description of the employee's document.

typeId.description: The ID of the document type.
